required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multi-omics Study of Metastatic Prostate Cancer (MOSMPCA)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-omics Study of Metastatic Prostate Cancer (MOSMPCA)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators plan to perform multi-omics technologies, including genomic, transcriptomic, epigenomic and proteomic methods, in patients with metastatic prostate cancer, aiming at uncovering the mechanism of the tumor progression, identifying distinct tumor subtypes and finding new treatment targets.

detailed_description.textblock:
Prostate cancer is the commonest malignancy and the second leading cause of tumor-related death among males worldwide. Though patients with early stage prostate cancer can obtain satisfactory therapeutic efficacy from radical prostatectomy or radiotherapy, the prognosis of men with metastatic prostate cancer (mPCa), especially metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC), is still poor. Recent years have witnessed the rapid development of the high-throughput technologies, including genomic, transcriptomic, epigenomic and proteomic methods. These techniques are promising in uncovering the mechanism of the tumor progression, identifying distinct tumor subtypes and finding new treatment targets.
In the current prospective study, the investigators plan to perform multi-omics technologies in patients with mPCa, aiming at uncovering the mechanism of the tumor progression, identifying distinct tumor subtypes and finding new treatment targets.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (initial diagnosis of PCa), until study completion (48 months)
primary_outcome.description: Mutation identified via whole-genome sequencing will be recored.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (initial diagnosis of PCa), until study completion (48 months)
primary_outcome.description: Determining the transcriptomic information of metastatic prostate cancer by performing whole transcriptome sequencing

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (initial diagnosis of PCa), until study completion (48 months)
primary_outcome.description: Determining the epigenomic status of specific genes by performing DNA-methylation sequencing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (initial diagnosis of PCa), until study completion (48 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Determing the expression status of centain proteins by performing immunohistochemistry in prostate biopsy specimen

study_pop.textblock: Patients with primary metastatic prostate cancer are potentially eligible for the current study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pathological confirmation of prostate cancer
- Age: â‰¥40 years old
- Bone or visceral metastatic disease confirmed by image examination.
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients harbouring other types of cancer besides prostate cancer

eligibility.gender_description: Only male patient can enter this study

responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice director of the department of urology
